definitions.definition: To accustom; to habituate. (Now common only in participial form. Uses the same pronunciation as the noun; see usage notes.)
definitions.example: soldiers who are used to hardships and danger

definitions.definition: (except in past tense) To habitually do; to be wont to do. (Now chiefly in past-tense forms; see used to.)
definitions.example: I used to get things done.

definitions.definition: To behave toward; to act with regard to; to treat.
